title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox struggled offensively, recording just two hits and losing 4-1 to the Yankees at Fenway Park.
Boston's offense went 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position, continuing a recent trend of missed opportunities.
Starter Lucas Giolito allowed two runs over 5.2 innings, while Boston's defense committed three errors in the loss.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr., Washington Commanders DE, suffers season-ending left quad injury during game against Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, injured while blocking an extra point; injury requires surgery, ending his NFL 2025 season.
Wise joined Commanders on a one-year, $3.25 million deal in March after eight years with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early may start against the Athletics next week at Fenway Park after an impressive MLB debut.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora is assessing pitching options with Craig Breslow to decide Early's next start by Sunday.
Young pitchers like Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison are also being considered for upcoming starts for the Red Sox.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman will decide on his contract opt-out after the Red Sox's season, per agent Scott Boras.
Bregman, 31, is in the first year of a three-year, $120 million contract with opt-outs after 2025 and 2026.
Bregman has a .279 batting average, 16 home runs, and 57 RBIs this season, influencing young Red Sox players.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Misery' is streaming on HBO Max, showcasing Kathy Bates' Oscar-winning role as Annie Wilkes in Stephen King's adaptation.
'Warfare,' co-directed by Ray Mendoza and Alex Garland, depicts a 2006 Iraq mission, available on HBO Max.
'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5, starring Steve Martin and Selena Gomez, is streaming on Hulu.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Keion White ruled out for Patriots' Week 2 game against the Miami Dolphins.
Gonzalez sidelined since July 28 with a hamstring injury; White out due to illness after playing Week 1.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and tackle Morgan Moses are questionable for Sunday's game in Miami.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays for the Patriots' game against the Dolphins due to Terrell Williams's absence.
Kuhr, the inside linebackers coach, previously filled in as playcaller during practices in Williams's offseason absence.
Mike Vrabel expressed confidence in Kuhr, citing his prior experience and preparation with the team.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case, filing notice ahead of her trial scheduled for October.
Charges involve defrauding nonprofit donors, lying on mortgage applications, and illegally collecting unemployment benefits.
Prosecutors agreed to a change-of-plea hearing; Cannon-Grant could face decades in prison and significant fines.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, 22, from Washington, Utah, is charged with aggravated murder and other felonies related to Charlie Kirk's shooting.
Robinson is an electrical apprentice student at Dixie Technical College, with no prior criminal record, from a Republican-voting family.
A social media confession and matching clothing linked Robinson to the Utah Valley University incident; he was taken into custody.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees clash in pivotal series at Fenway Park affecting American League wild-card race.
Boston leads season series 8-2, with top pitchers Giolito, Bello, and Crochet set to start.
Yankees' performance relies on home runs, hitting 249 this season, leading MLB in long balls.
